chirptask.google

Class GoogleController

  • java.lang.Object
    • chirptask.google.GoogleController
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable

    public class GoogleController
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Runnable
    GoogleController is the main component that interacts with the Google Services. The two main Google Services involved are: 1) Google Calendar 2) Google Tasks The main controller of Google Calendar is the CalendarController class. The main controller of Google Tasks is the TasksController class. Therefore, GoogleController maintains a global instance of these two. Aside from performing interactions with the two Google Services, GoogleController is the main class that authenticates ChirpTask with Google via OAuth2.0. The interactions with the Google Services is possible only with a valid Credential.

      • run

        public void run()
        To make Google Login/Authentication run in the background. It allows the program to continue running normally in the mean time.
        Specified by:
        run in interface java.lang.Runnable

      • isGoogleLoaded

        public static boolean isGoogleLoaded()
        Provides a checker if the required Google components loaded.
        Returns:
        true if all required components has been loaded; false if at least one component has not been loaded.

      • addTask

        public void addTask(Task taskToAdd)
        add(Task) will perform the relevant addTask method depending on the content of the chirptask.storage.Task object passed in. After the task has been added to the relevant Google Service, it will return the Google ID of the newly created task to update the entry in the local storage (xml file).
        Parameters:
        taskToAdd -
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
